title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 319.160 - Smoked pork sausage
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 319.160 - Smoked pork sausage

State Regulations

Smoked Pork Sausage is pork sausage that is smoked with
hardwood or other approved nonresinous materials. It may be seasoned with
condimental substances as permitted in Part 318 of this Article. It shall not
be made with any lot of product which, in the aggregate, contains more than 50
percent trimmable fat; that is, fat which can be removed by thorough
practicable trimming and sorting. To facilitate chopping or mixing, water or
ice may be used in an amount not to exceed three percent of the total
ingredients used. Notes

319.160

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
